perturbation.original_text: Turpin shall deliver to the Company all Work Product and Company Property, including all originals and copies thereof, in Turpin's possession and/or control, at the request of the Company, or, in the absence of such a request, upon the termination of Turpin's employment with the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Turpin shall deliver to the Company all Work Product and Company Property, including all originals and copies thereof, in Turpin's possession and/or control, only upon the Company's explicit request within 180 days of the termination of Turpin's employment with the Company; otherwise, Turpin has no obligation to return Work Product or Company Property.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the return of company property upon termination of employment, or at the request of the company. The modified text limits the time the company can request the return of company property to 180 days, implying that after this deadline, the returning of the property is no longer required. This conflicts with general legal principles related to the protection of trade secrets and company property, which generally do not have such strict time limitations and depend on how long the information remains protectable as a trade secret.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Principles of Trade Secret Law and Company Property Rights.

perturbation.original_text: Turpin shall, at the Company's request, assist with, execute and deliver all further documents, applications, declarations, verifications, submissions, transfers and assignments and do all other things requested by the Company, acting reasonably, during the term hereof and thereafter, at the expense of the Company, but without additional compensation, to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire, prosecute, perfect, enforce and/or maintain any and all right, title and interest, in any country, in and to the Confidential Information, the Work Product and the Intellectual Property Rights in same.
perturbation.changed_text: Turpin shall, at the Company's request, assist with, execute and deliver all further documents, applications, declarations, verifications, submissions, transfers and assignments and do all other things requested by the Company, acting reasonably, during the term hereof and for a period not exceeding 30 days following the termination of this agreement, at the expense of the Company, but without additional compensation, to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire, prosecute, perfect, enforce and/or maintain any and all right, title and interest, in any country, in and to the Confidential Information, the Work Product and the Intellectual Property Rights in same.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement states that after the termination of the agreement, Turpin is obliged to help with any legal documentation. By limiting this to 30 days, the modified text restricts the company's ability to secure intellectual property rights, potentially conflicting with legal obligations for reasonable cooperation in intellectual property matters. This is legally problematic as it creates a finite timeframe in assisting the company, regardless of the legal requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Principles of Intellectual Property Law and Obligation to Cooperate.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may, with written notice, be terminated by either party should Turpin's employment with the Company terminate for any reason. Termination under this Section 12 shall be effective from the date written notice is delivered or the date specified in the written notice. whichever is later.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be terminated by either party without written notice upon either party's discretion. Termination under this Section 12 shall be effective immediately.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires written notice for termination. The modified version allows immediate termination without notice. This contradicts employment standards legislation, which requires employers (and sometimes employees) to provide reasonable notice of termination or pay in lieu thereof. Terminating 'at will' without notice can violate these laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Employment Standards Legislation regarding termination notice periods.
